Name: Student Study Guide for Fundamentals of Physics

ReviewList.Text: While it did cause me to say "aha" on a couple problems, and it's use does help me understand some concepts, it's not really worth the cost unless you find it pretty cheap. My teacher has a very thick accent, so I sit through her lectures pretty unaware of what she's discussing. The set-up of the study guide isn't very helpful at all.

The book is written in the from of a conversation between a professor and a student. It doesn't cover as much material as I hoped it would, and unfortunately for me some of the finer points I hoped were covered weren't even mentioned, but it gets 2 stars because it does a few questions and shows how to do them step by step.

This is a helpful study guide covering the topics in each chapter to help student prepare for the AP Exam.  I will be using it this year as an AP Physics teacher to help my students prepare for the exam in May.
This is an excellent study guide, I could not have survived without it! Not only is it highly readable, it's succinct.
this book is borderline pointless. it contains about 4 randomly selected solutions for each chapter. leaving about 200 problems which i did not understand. waste of money.
